page.title: 01MARYCULTER:General Survey
page.content: Our block lies some 6 miles west of the city of Aberdeen, mainly on the south side of the River Dee. Most of the suburban housing is on the north side and the south is still largely pleasant parkland and woodland. Kingcausie Estate occupies a good part of our area. There is a rose farm with its adjoining tourist attraction Storybook Glen. There are small housing developments at Burnhead, Fernieslack, Kirkton. Milltimber in the north of our block is part of a larger housing scheme. Most people commute to Aberdeen and are engaged in oil related industries. The River Dee is a fine salmon fishing river. The whole area popularised by the Royal Family is favoured by visitors to Scotland.
